decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana, usually utilizing Gaea's Cradle, in order to play multiple Elves and trigger Glimpse of Nature to draw through the deck. This allows the player to assemble the necessary pieces for their combo, such as Natural Order or Green Sun's Zenith to tutor for key creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Ruric Thar, the Unbowed and removal with cards like Reclamation Sage and Scavenging Ooze.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt your opponent's game plan by utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow them down, while also applying pressure with efficient beaters like Serra Avenger and Mirran Crusader. The deck also aims to control the board with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Flickerwisp, and generate card advantage with Stoneforge Mystic and Aether Vial. The inclusion of powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice further solidify the deck's aggressive and disruptive strategy.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of disruptive spells and efficient creatures, ultimately winning through powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte. The deck is able to protect its threats with counterspells like Force of Will and removal in the form of Swords to Plowshares, while generating value with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Lingering Souls. With a variety of planeswalkers and versatile spells, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents, closing out games with a well-timed sweeper like Supreme Verdict or Toxic Deluge.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying pressure through efficient creatures and equipment. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth slow down spell-based decks, while Phyrexian Revoker shuts down key abilities. Stoneforge Mystic tutors up powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to further increase aggression. Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment, while Karakas provides utility against legendary threats. Wasteland and Rishadan Port disrupt the opponent's mana base, making it difficult for them to recover. The deck aims to control the game and close it out quickly with aggressive threats.

This combo deck aims to quickly cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand by casting Show and Tell or Sneak Attack. The deck includes card draw like Brainstorm and Ponder, along with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo. With efficient mana sources like Lotus Petal and lands that produce multiple mana like City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb, the deck can execute its game plan efficiently. Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides additional card advantage and control.

The main concept of this Legacy deck is to disrupt your opponent's hand and board while applying pressure with efficient creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Wasteland to disrupt your opponent's game plan, while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf, Delver of Secrets, and Deathrite Shaman to quickly close out the game. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil to control the game and generate card advantage. The deck aims to out-tempo and out-value the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil. It also utilizes the synergy between Stoneforge Mystic and equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull to gain tempo and card advantage. The deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan with discard spells like Thoughtseize and disruptive creatures like True-Name Nemesis. It has access to a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana development and disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by efficiently answering threats with cards like Terminus, Swords to Plowshares, Council's Judgment, and Force of Will. The deck utilizes various counterspells like Counterspell and Counterbalance to disrupt opponents' game plans. Card advantage and manipulation are key with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Sensei's Divining Top, and Brainstorm. The mana base allows for flexibility and consistency in casting spells, while the win condition is typically finishing the game with angels generated by Entreat the Angels or through card advantage from Jace, the Mind Sculptor.

The main concept of this deck is to apply early pressure with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf, Delver of Secrets, and Deathrite Shaman while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Hymn to Tourach, Force of Will, and Abrupt Decay. The deck also focuses on card advantage through Dark Confidant and card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. The mana base is designed to provide a good mix of colors for the spells in the deck, with Wasteland included to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through elf creatures and Gaea's Cradle in order to power out powerful threats like Craterhoof Behemoth. It includes various cards to help draw through the deck quickly and find the necessary pieces to assemble a game-winning combo, often utilizing Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a massive board state and finish them off with a huge attack powered by Craterhoof Behemoth's ability.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent through efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf. The deck also focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland, Stifle, and Spell Pierce, while protecting its own threats with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game and secure a quick victory through aggressive plays and efficient use of its resources.

The primary focus of this Legacy Aggro deck is to quickly deploy threats like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Wasteland, Stifle, and Spell Pierce. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game through efficient card draw and countermagic with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Force of Will. By maintaining a proactive game plan and utilizing a variety of versatile spells, the deck looks to maintain a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure a victory.

The deck utilizes the synergy between Life from the Loam, Crop Rotation, and various land cards to control the game by constantly recurring powerful lands such as The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Dark Depths combo with Thespian's Stage. It also includes disruptive spells like Smallpox, Liliana of the Veil, and Gamble to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to grind out advantages over time while disrupting the opponent's resources, eventually overpowering them with its land-based win conditions.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and casting a high number of spells in one turn to build up a storm count, eventually leading to a lethal Tendrils of Agony finish. It includes fast mana sources like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal, along with efficient card selection and disruption spells to help set up the combo. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a sudden burst of spells and finish the game before they can mount a defense.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 deck focuses on utilizing the combo of "Show and Tell" to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck includes cards like Omniscience and Dream Halls to cast spells for free, while also running protective spells like Force of Will and Pact of Negation. The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana production using Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors and then play Enter the Infinite to draw the entire deck and win the game in one turn.

The deck focuses on using efficient, low-cost spells and creatures to apply pressure and control the board. By playing cards like Delver of Secrets and Stoneforge Mystic, the deck aims to quickly establish a threatening board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. The inclusion of equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull provide additional power and flexibility to push for victory. With a mix of card draw, removal, and threats, the deck seeks to maintain tempo and outpace the opponent in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.
